predicate.note: Frames file for 'thwart' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry, no Framenet entry. No comparison. This is truly one of the most wondrous verbs of English. I mean, just listen to it: "thwart". Sounds like an obese toad falling six stories onto pavement.

example.name: just transitive
example.text: But the new pact will force huge debt on the new firm and could still fail to thwart rival suitor McCaw Cellular.

example.name: with instrumental adjunct
example.text: In February 1987, Bally thwarted a possible hostile takeover bid from Mr. Trump by agreeing to buy 2.6 million of Mr. Trump's 3.1 million Bally shares for $83.7 million -- more than $18 million above market price.
example.arg: a possible hostile takeover bid from Mr. Trump
by agreeing to buy 2.6 million of Mr. Trump's 3.1 million Bally shares for $83.7 million -- more than $18 million above market price
